pages.text: Any respectable druid can carve enchanted runes, allowing natural (or otherworldly) energies to flow through the ancient symbols. However, a sword is far too long an inelegant for carving. Instead, druids use $(l:apparatus/knives)Knives$() for their various runes, carving into stone and wood alike.
Druids call this "Runic Carving" and can engrave this runes while holding the required $(l:herbs)Herb$() in their offhand, which is consumed in the process.$(br2)
Examples can be found in the $(l:runes)Runes$() chapter of Patchouli book
